paper.title: Randomized online graph coloring

author.org: Dept. of Comput. Sci., Chicago Univ., IL, USA

paper.abstract: It is shown that randomization helps in coloring graphs online, and a simple randomized online algorithm is presented. For 3-colorable graphs the expected number of colors the algorithm uses is O((n log n)/sup 1/2/). The algorithm runs in polynomial time and compares well with the best known polynomial-time offline algorithms. A lower bound is proved for the randomized algorithm. u003e
